result.execSummary:
The defendant James P Hill II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail applied to costs. Costs paid in full.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-No violent contact with the Victim or Witness. 
-Domestic Violence counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program. 
-No dangerous weapons. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James P Hill II

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 10:13 AM
Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for James P Hill II.
Defendant James P Hill II in court. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
60-DAYS JAIL
Sentence to run Consecutive to 22CM232 and 22CM0942.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent Contact with the Victim or Witness
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash Bail to be applied to the costs/surcharges, and the balance is to be refunded to the poster*
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is to have no violent contact with Victim A.
Defendant is to have no violent contact with Witness A or B.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant is not to discuss this case with Victim A.

Case called at 1:41 PM 
Andy Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James P Hill in court with attorney J. Andrew Herbers as friend of the Court. 
Attorney Herbers indicates that the Public Defender's Office will be appoint him on this case.
Defense acknowledges receiving the Criminal Complaint, waives its reading, and enters a not guilty plea.
Cash Bond was previously set at $1,500.00.
Court will Modify the Conditions of the Cash Bond.
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is to have no violent contact with Victim A.
Defendant is to have no violent contact with Witness A or B.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant is not to discuss this case with Victim A. 
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
